    • NULISAseqR User Guide

NULISAseqR Package

System Requirements

  • R (version 4.4+)

How to install

Run the following R code (typical installation time < 5 minutes).

install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github(
  "Alamar-Biosciences/NULISAseqR",
  ref = "main"
)

Load the package in R with library(NULISAseqR).

Demo: Loading Data 

library("NULISAseqR")
test_file_path <- system.file(
  "rmarkdown/templates/nulisaseq/skeleton",
  "detectability_P1_Tr03.xml",
  package="NULISAseqR"
)
data <- loadNULISAseq(test_file_path)

Demo: Generating Report

Run the following to generate a QC report ( < 5 minutes).

rmd_path <- system.file("rmarkdown/templates/nulisaseq/skeleton","skeleton.Rmd", package="NULISAseqR")
rmarkdown::render(
  rmd_path,
  params=list(
    dataDir=dirname(test_file_path),
    xmlFiles=basename(test_file_path)
  )
)

Local Development

This package uses renv for dependency management. Please refer to the Using a Project with an Existing renv Setup section of the R Environment Management Guide (using renv) developer guide for more information.

⚠️ Note: By default, the renv setup ignores NULISAseqAQ and PCAtools, the dynamic internal/external packages that some functions of this package depend on. During R session loading a warning will be shown if these dependencies are not found. This is expected behavior. In that case, install NULISAseqAQ and PCAtools from GitHub using the following commands:

renv::install("Alamar-Biosciences/NULISAseqAQ@1.4-dev")
renv::install("Alamar-Biosciences/PCAtools@master")

This will install the NULISAseqAQ from the 1.4-dev branch of the GitHub repository and the PCAtools from the master branch of the GitHub repository.

Refer to the Internal Packages sections of the developer guide under Installing Packages and Maintenance of the developer guide for more information.
